Replies.Reply: There are no wolves in the woods so close to the city.
You have a gun! How do you have a gun? Why should you carry such a weapon?
He's not dressed like a hunter. Why is he alone? Hunters always go in pairs. For safety.
Go for help. Call the police.
Actually it's a syndicate. Lots of different publications. Um... Casa editrice.
Did I forget to mention my electromagnetic hypersensitivity?
This is a small town, Larry. I don't like small towns. I grew up in one. Besides, I'm already attracting attention.
Un po' di formaggio, per favore.
Una gelata alla fragola. Per favore.
What car did they give you?
You want a submachine gun to fit in a lady's purse?
A small briefcase would be possible.
X-rays? Camouflage: lap-top, DVD player, MP3 or digital camera?

No such thing. You'll have to make do with a suppressor like everyone else. It'll dampen the decibels, dislocate the sound source and reduce muzzle flash. I can't make you silent but I can make you invisible as the Finnish phrase goes, but only as long as you're prepared to lose some range.
By the clothes stall. Light blue shirt, open at the neck, expensive buff suede shoes. Is he with you?
You want a weapon with the firing capacity of a submachine gun and the range of a rifle.
Give me a month. To trial. Then a week for final adjustments.
I hope you paid below the odds. The more you pay them the more cops gossip in the locker room.
Have you ever wanted to be anything other than a priest?
I do what I'm good at.
I'm not a young man. I have my savings.
I don't think God is interested in me. Father.
What are the snakes for, father?
Sono un amico di Padre Benedetto.
I'm taking pictures forty minutes north of here. Right up in the mountains. Father Benedetto said you might be able to help.
My publisher wouldn't stretch to a four by four and the park trails are playing havoc with my chassis.
Not really. I just need something to work on a ruptured driveshaft.
If he's not baby-sitting the Belgian contract then he's either a Joe, a cop or a shooter. He's not with The Company, they're fast: it's been three days and no TA.
The Carabinieri around here like roadblocks. It's cover.
I'll wake you before the turn-off.
Derelict. I checked three days ago.
I'll check alone. There are adders the mountains. And vipers. Your shoes.
You'd be out of a job.
It's hard to like something you know nothing about.
At least three hundred and sixty miles per hour. That's including twenty off the top for the sound suppression.
You'll find it easy. I've re-
No major recoil issues. You should be able to hold onto any target.
A briefcase. Samsonite. Standard pattern in black with combination locks. Is there a number you'd prefer?
It wouldn't look right if the picnic wasn't touched.
It had to be chilled. They're Italian cops.
I'm much older than you. By the time you've retired I'll be dead.
You might have to act with your other clients but you don't have to pretend anything at all with me.
I want you to be yourself with me.
I don't sleep with the other girls.
It's nothing really. Just a broken rib. Un costollo rotta?
No, no, no. I have pain killers. I just need a strong cup of coffee.
How did he know I was here, Larry?
Will you take a coffee with me?
Due cappuccini e un cafe corretto.
If not with gold, than at least not with enough medieval cobbles to loosen every-self tapping screw in a Fiat.
Where do you come from, Anna?
Maybe we should try something different.
See you then, Clara. It was a delight to meet you Anna.
What makes you think I'm leaving?
I don't seek peace. I never have.
Perhaps. Perhaps I'll stay. The valley. The villages. The mountains.
I see a whore. She's young enough to be my daughter.
Everyone's on the run from something.
I've done nothing I didn't have good cause to do.
You know a lot about me.
He looks like you. Even more than he does in the photos you keep of each other. Where was he conceived, father? Under one of these trees?
I wasn't sure you meant me to.
I doubt any of the couples here are. With the exception of the Germans at table seven. She's wearing a wedding ring and they haven't spoken a word to each other for eight and half minutes.
What makes you think I have a secret? I'm an ordinary man. I cough. I fart. I earn a living.
Eat shit and die, pimple dick?
I guess I've led a sheltered life.
Would you be flattering me if I wasn't a client?
I don't deliver, Larry. I never deliver. It's too dangerous. She comes to me. I know the town.
Where the hell's this information coming from?
They can. They can trust me and so can you.
I've never jeopardised an operation in my life.
Put them in the back. We've got a way to go.
An hour. And we're not going to the sea, we're going to the lakes. In the mountains.
We're going off the beaten track.
There's no need to worry. I've been here before several times. Taking photographs.
You're not afraid of coming into the wild with me, are you?
This was made by the French for taking potatoes to market. Besides, I always come here in this car.
Of course. I don't want to walk back to town any more than you do.
No. Not quite. We go another hundred metres, through the wood.
You won't need to hold on. I'll go slowly. Just relax and look.
If we stay here for a year, they'll devour us.
I promised myself that I would write to you- as your friend- to say goodbye.
I never thought the day would come when I'd run out of reasons.
Or maybe I've just found a reason to change.
I still don't understand. What's the point of a gun if it's not loaded?
Does the gun make you feel safer with me?
Then why's it in your purse?
Maybe this is suicide. Cops often put the graft on working girls.
I guess I'll go to work too.
It's not that I've given up on life, Father. Just the way that I was living it. If you can call it living.
If I had one request, Father, it would be this. That it's not Clara who finally pulls the trigger. But whoever it is...
...by this time tomorrow I'll be dead.
I guessed you'd have a sweet tooth.
I suppose I'll read about this in the Times or the International Herald Tribune. Or Il Maessagiero.
How do you know I'm retiring?
If I asked you would you come away with me?
Wherever. Then when we're through, we could come back here. For good.
Someone got what was coming to them.
Clara. My name is not Eduardo.
Jack. What brings you to Rome?
There's a bar across the street: the L'Aquila. Freshen up. Sit tight. Give me two hours.
city. But you can't go far, either.
So. You find a hole- somewhere nearby- and you crawl into it and you stay put until I say it's safe to come out.
Turn right outside the bar then second left. Via Spinetti. You'll find a silver Citroen C2 with Chieti plates. Check the glove box and follow the map. Castelvecchio.
Do you have any idea how long I've been trying to reach you? What happened to the cell I gave you?
Don't get jumpy on me, Jack. That cell was secure.
I've got a job. It's a custom fit.
Relax. She triple checks out. Plus she comes to you. You don't have to move an inch.
So will anyone who's trying to kill you.
Think about this. I cleaned up your shit and made you disappear. You owe me my usual twenty percent commission plus the first installment. The rest is yours.
Clean bill of health and no OC.
You got a long list of enemies, Jack.
Want me to help take care of this?
I appreciate the value of a pre-
Are you out of your fucking mind, Jack?
After everything I've done for you?
We don't know yet. I'll call you ten am on the day with a venue.
even the slightest chance security had been breached, you'd have dealt with it immediately.
Our pretty young Belgian client and her associates think someone on your long list of enemies might have put a tail on you.
Course not, Jack. But if, for the sake of argument, it was possible-
The Belgians think they're planning to wait for the drop and exterminate you and Mathilde in one swoop.
to keep a tight lid on operations the who could we trust?
You don't have to tell me that, Jack. For Christ's sake, you closed your own girlfriend's account...
He rubs his eyes, wearied by his own insensitivity.
That was, um.... I'm just saying you can be relied on.
Not only did you not kill him, you gave him my fucking money?

He's paranoid. That's why I'm paying you the GDP of a small country to get close to him. You could have got him in the sack. You should have got him in the car park. Now you're going to have to take him out long range!
Let's hope his workmanship is up to scratch.
Sweden turned Jack into a liability. Three stiffs: two shooters and an innocent civilian.
Never mind Larson. He didn't stand a chance, not against someone as paranoid as Jack. The Swede was only there to take Jack's heat off you. So don't fuck this up again.
Is there any actual candy in this gas guzzler?
You're too old for this life, Jack.
You get sentimental then you fuck things up.
Va bene! You stay at Pensione Arbruzzo.
Va bene. Che genere de fotografia?
Va bene. So you must share a glass of wine with me. Questa sera. This evening.
Certo. You want to know the truth about Abruzzo? A priest sees everything.
Que siamo! The quality of the brandy is good, the liquor is smooth and the glass warmed by the sun.
The only good thing to come from the Francesi, everything else...
The French are... pezzi di merda.
Forgive me. I speak too fast. You study our history?
You come to Italy to make a guide book and you don't care about history?
Of course. You are American. You think you can escape history. You live for the present.
All the sheep in my flock are dear to me, but some are dearer than most. Especially those that have strayed from the fold.
doctor'. But I suspect his practice is not entirely sound. Ecco!
Fagiano. Pheasant. With sauce of orange juice, orange peel, chestnuts, garlic, Marsala wine and... Come si dici in Inglese?
The Holy Father eats better than this.
Have you ever wanted to be anything other than a... come se dice in Inglese...?
I'm sure you have other talents.
Journalism cannot make you a rich man.
My meagre income is subject to the vagaries of the stock market and with church attendance declining there's less and less money in the offertory. But if a man has God in his vaults...
I know better than to try to make a convert over pheasant and Trebbiano.
"The grave soul keeps its own secrets, and takes its own punishment in silence."
A man was here asking questions about you.
He came to the church this afternoon.
To know where you live. He said he was a friend from Switzerland.
Of course I do not tell him. How do I know him? He is maybe the police.

If you live in Italy, and you are a man of the cloth, you meet many people. Besides, I lived once in Naples. If you live in Naples you know the difference between a fat wallet and a... custodia per armi di spalla. How you say in English?
I make a mistake. He did not say he was from La Svizzera: Switzerland.

I walk here to meditate. Once a week, Wednesday, the farthest one can travel in the week from the Sabbath. The trees are like the Stations of the Cross: by certain trees I thank God for certain favours he has granted me, or certain gifts he has made to me and all men. For example, here by this pine, I thank him for the many friendships I have and ask him to look after those of my friends who are troubled.
Some walk here in the cool of evening. Others come at night.
I wonder how many bastards have been made here?
Perhaps you'll stay and settle here yourself?
Some are greater sinners than others. And those who seek peace have much sinning in their history.
Forgive me. This is the priest in me speaking. And the friend. But you have done much sinning, Signor Clarke. You still do.
I do not refer to the sins of carnality. But to the deadly sins...
We are not discussing theology, my friend, but you. You like this town, this valley.
You should like to remain here and find your peace at last. Yet you cannot. There is something you cannot ignore. Some force. Some enemy.
You want to speak but you dare not.
What job do you do, Signor? Are you on the run, as they say?
Some men watch some of the shadows.
Do you wish to tell me?
For your own sake. Perhaps I can pray for you?
You work in metal. You are given some steel by Fabio, the car doctor.
I know only what you do in the town. People talk to me. I am their priest and they trust me.
Why do you ask me that?
I do not remember, Signor. It was twenty-five years ago.
In the end it is I who confesses to you.
Perhaps. For your own good. You cannot doubt the existence of Hell.
What do you have, my friend?
Dear Father Benedetto. I promised myself that I would write to you-
I will them that the man who wrote this letter is my friend.
You're assuming I'm English or you'd never have mentioned the weather. In fact I'm Belgian but I went to boarding school in England.
Una spremute di limone. Per favore.
It's hot. My car has no air conditioning. I asked for it, but...

Five seconds. Seven at the most.

I didn't see him. In any case, I'm alone.
I can accept a slight loss of range.
Mr. Clarke. How good to see you again.
You would be hard pressed to make a fast get away in this.
I would have thought you to have had at least an Alfa Romeo.
The train was tiring. One has to keep alert so much in cities.
I told you I work alone.
You have tested the gun here before?
I wish everywhere could be this tranquil.
I should like a hundred of each.
I have made my own targets.
You've done a good job, Mr. Clarke.
Go to the stones and fire near me.
...into the bush with the yellow flowers. Two bursts. Five seconds apart.
The sound suppression is superb. I couldn't place the direction of fire.
I shall require the rounds and the weapon by the first of next month.
What do you want done with these?
You chilled the wine. I thought...
You've never taken a woman here before?
Perhaps you do not have a woman in your life. It is not easy for us to keep relationships. Not in our world.
I wish you hadn't brought me here.
This is the sort of place I wish I'd discovered by myself. Then maybe one day I could have retired here. But you already know it.
On the first of next month?
Thank you for a lovely day. Mr.

Hello. I see you have brought it in from the car with you.

I'm just going to the ladies. Wait here.
Have you taken your girl up to the meadow yet?

He made short work of the last guy you hired.

Want me to take a look?

But you have to go to the hospital!
I know a place which make the strongest coffee in L'Aquila.
His eyes open wide and he turns to her quickly.
You have a tattoo. On your back.
My friend Anna. This is my friend Signor Farfalla.
Anna is like all Italians. She thinks America is like in the movies. Little Italy, "West Side Story", "Chicago".
I tell her in these times America is like here, there, anywhere. The streets are not... pave-ed with gold.
Perhaps we will have a drink together soon? I am free...
But Eduardo... Where would you like to meet?
I forgot. Where is our usual place?
Where would you like to try, Eduardo?
I did not think you would come.
Una botiglia di acqua minerale non gasata et... una Parasini, per favore.
Una botiglia di acqua minerale et una Parasini, per favore.
Parasini. From Calabria. It is good, you will agree?
Can I ask you something, Eduardo?
I was sure this was your secret.
I do not think you are an ordinary man. I think you are a good man.
He thinks we are a couple.
As long as we know it is an illusion.
It is good, you will agree?
You know how to swear in Italian?
"Imbecile?" Eduardo! Try: Mangia merde e morte: tuo cazzo un brufolo.
For this I do. My job.
Except this job is full of testa di cazzo.
But you are too young to...
This cannot be for sale. But I am not want to... come se dice?
Stronzo! I buy you a present!
My apartment is not far from here.
How far do we go? To Fanale?
For a... come se dice... you have in the back...
A pick-nick! We are going for a pick-nick. Just the two of us.
I have practise my English, Eduardo. I love to have pick-nick.
You will speak Italian. One day, I will teach you.
I think it is good we should stay close to the road.
Of course I am not. Not with you.
You should have a jeep. A Toyota.
I think you are crazy. This will go to nowhere.
I am going to swim in the lake. Are you coming?
He is an Italian bird! We disturb his siesta!
It is said that if these fishes bite at two hands holding, then love is good for the people.
Do you make love in the water?
You are sure you are not married, Eduardo?
Will you put this on my back?

One of the girls borrow it to me after the second hooker in Chieti is murdered. With some of the clients it make me feel safe. I don't tell the police, of course, but... Madonna, Eduardo. How they do to these two women! A police agente from Rome show me photographs. They show photographs to everyone in Via Lampedusa.
Non capito... how one person hurt another in this way.
I have to work tonight, amore.
And after that? Tomorrow and the next day.
I want always to stay here.
Let me come to your home.
You come to my apartment after.
I love you, Signor Eduardo Farfalla.
I am very well thank you.
Ah. I have not been to England only to France. But I would love to go to America.
